channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SciTweets -- A Dataset and Annotation Framework for Detecting Scientific Online Discourse
item.description: Scientific topics, claims and resources are increasingly debated as part of online discourse, where prominent examples include discourse related to COVID-19 or climate change.

item.title: Self-Supervised Learning of Image Scale and Orientation
item.description: We study the problem of learning to assign a characteristic pose, i. e., scale and orientation, for an image region of interest.

item.title: Variable Bitrate Neural Fields
item.description: Neural approximations of scalar and vector fields, such as signed distance functions and radiance fields, have emerged as accurate, high-quality representations.

item.title: Accurate Emotion Strength Assessment for Seen and Unseen Speech Based on Data-Driven Deep Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose a data-driven deep learning model, i. e. StrengthNet, to improve the generalization of emotion strength assessment for seen and unseen speech.

item.title: XMorpher: Full Transformer for Deformable Medical Image Registration via Cross Attention
item.description: An effective backbone network is important to deep learning-based Deformable Medical Image Registration (DMIR), because it extracts and matches the features between two images to discover the mutual correspondence for fine registration.

item.title: Human Eyes Inspired Recurrent Neural Networks are More Robust Against Adversarial Noises
item.description: Compared to human vision, computer vision based on convolutional neural networks (CNN) are more vulnerable to adversarial noises.

item.title: Coarse-to-Fine Vision-Language Pre-training with Fusion in the Backbone
item.description: Vision-language (VL) pre-training has recently received considerable attention.

item.title: Rethinking Generalization in Few-Shot Classification
item.description: Single image-level annotations only correctly describe an often small subset of an image's content, particularly when complex real-world scenes are depicted.

item.title: PolyU-BPCoMa: A Dataset and Benchmark Towards Mobile Colorized Mapping Using a Backpack Multisensorial System
item.description: Color checker boards are pasted in each surveyed area as targets and ground truth data are collected by an advanced terrestrial laser scanner (TLS).

item.title: A Simple Data Mixing Prior for Improving Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: More notably, our SDMP is the first method that successfully leverages data mixing to improve (rather than hurt) the performance of Vision Transformers in the self-supervised setting.

item.title: ParamNet: A Multi-Layer Parametric Network for Joint Channel Estimation and Symbol Detection
item.description: This paper proposes a parametric-based network architecture for joint channel estimation and data detection in communications systems with hardware impairments.

item.title: A smile is all you need: Predicting limiting activity coefficients from SMILES with natural language processing
item.description: This training strategy enables SPT to accurately predict limiting activity coefficients even for unknown molecules, cutting the mean prediction error in half compared to state-of-the-art models for activity coefficient predictions such as COSMO-RS, UNIFAC, and improving on recent machine learning approaches.

item.title: On Numerical Integration in Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
item.description: The combination of ordinary differential equations and neural networks, i. e., neural ordinary differential equations (Neural ODE), has been widely studied from various angles.

item.title: Estimating the Optimal Covariance with Imperfect Mean in Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: Thus, the generation performance on a subset of timesteps is crucial, which is greatly influenced by the covariance design in DPMs.

item.title: Towards ML Methods for Biodiversity: A Novel Wild Bee Dataset and Evaluations of XAI Methods for ML-Assisted Rare Species Annotations
item.description: Insects are a crucial part of our ecosystem.

item.title: Fast and Reliable Evaluation of Adversarial Robustness with Minimum-Margin Attack
item.description: The AutoAttack (AA) has been the most reliable method to evaluate adversarial robustness when considerable computational resources are available.

item.title: Prefix Language Models are Unified Modal Learners
item.description: With the success of vision-language pre-training, we have witnessed the state-of-the-art has been pushed on multi-modal understanding and generation.

item.title: Fair Ranking as Fair Division: Impact-Based Individual Fairness in Ranking
item.description: Our axioms of envy-freeness and dominance over uniform ranking postulate that for a fair ranking policy every item should prefer their own rank allocation over that of any other item, and that no item should be actively disadvantaged by the rankings.

item.title: Text-Aware End-to-end Mispronunciation Detection and Diagnosis
item.description: In the field of assessing the pronunciation quality of constrained speech, the given transcriptions can play the role of a teacher.

item.title: S\textsuperscript{2}-FPN: Scale-ware Strip Attention Guided Feature Pyramid Network for Real-time Semantic Segmentation
item.description: This paper presents a new model to achieve a trade-off between accuracy/speed for real-time road scene semantic segmentation.

item.title: RecBole 2.0: Towards a More Up-to-Date Recommendation Library
item.description: In order to support the study of recent advances in recommender systems, this paper presents an extended recommendation library consisting of eight packages for up-to-date topics and architectures.

item.title: The SIGMORPHON 2022 Shared Task on Morpheme Segmentation
item.description: The SIGMORPHON 2022 shared task on morpheme segmentation challenged systems to decompose a word into a sequence of morphemes and covered most types of morphology: compounds, derivations, and inflections.

item.title: Rethinking Generalization in Few-Shot Classification
item.description: Single image-level annotations only correctly describe an often small subset of an image's content, particularly when complex real-world scenes are depicted.

item.title: Zero-shot object goal visual navigation
item.description: Object goal visual navigation is a challenging task that aims to guide a robot to find the target object only based on its visual observation, and the target is limited to the classes specified in the training stage.

item.title: Training Discrete Deep Generative Models via Gapped Straight-Through Estimator
item.description: While deep generative models have succeeded in image processing, natural language processing, and reinforcement learning, training that involves discrete random variables remains challenging due to the high variance of its gradient estimation process.

item.title: "Why Here and Not There?" -- Diverse Contrasting Explanations of Dimensionality Reduction
item.description: Dimensionality reduction is a popular preprocessing and a widely used tool in data mining.

item.title: LET-3D-AP: Longitudinal Error Tolerant 3D Average Precision for Camera-Only 3D Detection
item.description: The popular object detection metric 3D Average Precision (3D AP) relies on the intersection over union between predicted bounding boxes and ground truth bounding boxes.

item.title: Label Matching Semi-Supervised Object Detection
item.description: To remedy this issue, we present a novel label assignment mechanism for self-training framework, namely proposal self-assignment, which injects the proposals from student into teacher and generates accurate pseudo labels to match each proposal in the student model accordingly.

item.title: Stand-Alone Inter-Frame Attention in Video Models
item.description: In this paper, we present a new recipe of inter-frame attention block, namely Stand-alone Inter-Frame Attention (SIFA), that novelly delves into the deformation across frames to estimate local self-attention on each spatial location.

item.title: Automated Precision Localization of Peripherally Inserted Central Catheter Tip through Model-Agnostic Multi-Stage Networks
item.description: In internal validation, when MFCN was applied to the existing single model, MFP was improved by an average of 45%.

item.title: Astock: A New Dataset and Automated Stock Trading based on Stock-specific News Analyzing Model
item.description: In addition, we propose a self-supervised learning strategy based on SRLP to enhance the out-of-distribution generalization performance of our system.

item.title: Understanding Narratives through Dimensions of Analogy
item.description: Experiments with language models and neuro-symbolic AI reasoners on these tasks reveal that state-of-the-art methods can be applied to reason by analogy with a limited success, motivating the need for further research towards comprehensive and scalable analogical reasoning by AI.

item.title: MBGDT:Robust Mini-Batch Gradient Descent
item.description: In high dimensions, most machine learning method perform fragile even there are a little outliers.

item.title: Task Transfer and Domain Adaptation for Zero-Shot Question Answering
item.description: Pretrained language models have shown success in various areas of natural language processing, including reading comprehension tasks.

item.title: DoWhy-GCM: An extension of DoWhy for causal inference in graphical causal models
item.description: We introduce DoWhy-GCM, an extension of the DoWhy Python library, that leverages graphical causal models.

item.title: Unbiased Estimation using the Underdamped Langevin Dynamics
item.description: In this work we consider the unbiased estimation of expectations w. r. t.~probability measures that have non-negative Lebesgue density, and which are known point-wise up-to a normalizing constant.

item.title: RF-Next: Efficient Receptive Field Search for Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Our search scheme exploits both global search to find the coarse combinations and local search to get the refined receptive field combinations further.

item.title: Regularizing a Model-based Policy Stationary Distribution to Stabilize Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Offline reinforcement learning (RL) extends the paradigm of classical RL algorithms to purely learning from static datasets, without interacting with the underlying environment during the learning process.

item.title: Shopping Queries Dataset: A Large-Scale ESCI Benchmark for Improving Product Search
item.description: This paper introduces the "Shopping Queries Dataset", a large dataset of difficult Amazon search queries and results, publicly released with the aim of fostering research in improving the quality of search results.

item.title: A Multi-task Framework for Infrared Small Target Detection and Segmentation
item.description: First, with the use of UNet as the backbone to maintain resolution and semantic information, our model can achieve a higher detection accuracy than other state-of-the-art methods by attaching a simple anchor-free head.

item.title: Adversarial Vulnerability of Randomized Ensembles
item.description: In this work we address this question both theoretically and empirically.

item.title: TransVG++: End-to-End Visual Grounding with Language Conditioned Vision Transformer
item.description: For another, we devise Language Conditioned Vision Transformer that removes external fusion modules and reuses the uni-modal ViT for vision-language fusion at the intermediate layers.

item.title: Scaling ResNets in the Large-depth Regime
item.description: initializations, the only non-trivial dynamics is for $\alpha_L = 1/\sqrt{L}$ (other choices lead either to explosion or to identity mapping).

item.title: Supervised Dictionary Learning with Auxiliary Covariates
item.description: Supervised dictionary learning (SDL) is a classical machine learning method that simultaneously seeks feature extraction and classification tasks, which are not necessarily a priori aligned objectives.

item.title: LIFT: Language-Interfaced Fine-Tuning for Non-Language Machine Learning Tasks
item.description: LIFT does not make any changes to the model architecture or loss function, and it solely relies on the natural language interface, enabling "no-code machine learning with LMs."

item.title: Exploring Representation of Horn Clauses using GNNs
item.description: For the second challenge, we explore graph representations of CHCs, and propose a new Relational Hypergraph Neural Network (R-HyGNN) architecture to learn program features.

item.title: CHQ-Summ: A Dataset for Consumer Healthcare Question Summarization
item.description: The quest for seeking health information has swamped the web with consumers' health-related questions.

item.title: Exploring Adversarial Attacks and Defenses in Vision Transformers trained with DINO
item.description: This work conducts the first analysis on the robustness against adversarial attacks on self-supervised Vision Transformers trained using DINO.

item.title: LAVENDER: Unifying Video-Language Understanding as Masked Language Modeling
item.description: In this work, we explore a unified VidL framework LAVENDER, where Masked Language Modeling (MLM) is used as the common interface for all pre-training and downstream tasks.

item.title: Online Easy Example Mining for Weakly-supervised Gland Segmentation from Histology Images
item.description: Existing weakly-supervised semantic segmentation methods in computer vision achieve degenerative results for gland segmentation, since the characteristics and problems of glandular datasets are different from general object datasets.
